name.definition: Ein eindeutiger Name, um das Material aufzufinden.

about.definition: Eine Beschreibung, die den Menschen hilft, den Zweck des Materials zu verstehen.

author.definition: Name der Person oder Organisation, die das Material erstellt hat.

publisher.definition: Name der Person oder Organisation, die das Material herausgegeben hat.

inLanguage.definition: Die Sprache in der das Material verfasst ist.

accessibilityAPI.definition: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API.

accessibilityControl.definition: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource.

accessibilityFeature.definition: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility.

accessibilityHazard.definition: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3.

timeRequired.definition: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience.

educationalRole.definition: The role that describes the target audience of the content. Note: schema.org/EducationalAudience is a subtype of Schema.org/Audience.

educationalAlignment.definition: An alignment to an established educational framework.

alignmentType.definition: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: assesses, teaches, requires, textComplexity, readingLevel,educationalSubject, and educationalLevel.

educationalFramework.definition: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

targetDescription.definition: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

targetName.definition: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

targetURL.definition: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

educationalUse.definition: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

typicalAgeRange.definition: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

interactivityType.definition: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

learningResourceType.definition: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

isBasedOnUrl.definition: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.
